Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.view.gui.scene.gamecomponents

Class BoardListManager

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.view.gui.scene.gamecomponents.BoardListManager
public class BoardListManager extends Object
Layout manager for the board list.

  • Constructor Details

    • BoardListManager

      public BoardListManager (javafx.scene.layout.Pane boardListPane, String myUsername, boolean isExpertMode, javafx.beans.binding.BooleanBinding areStudentsClickable, javafx.beans.property.ListProperty<Board> boards, javafx.beans.property.ListProperty<Professor> professors, BiConsumer<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent,PieceColor> onStudentCLick)
      Creates a new instance with the given parameters
      Parameters:
      boardListPane - The pane to inject the dynamic content into
      myUsername - The username of the player on this client
      isExpertMode - Flag indicating whether the current match is in expert mode or not
      areStudentsClickable - Boolean binding indicating whether the layout should be interactive
      boards - The boards property
      professors - The professors property
      onStudentCLick - Handler for when a student is clicked
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null

  • Method Details

    • startManaging

      public void startManaging()
      Start reactively managing the layout.

      Note: the absence of a stopManaging() here is intentional. The lifecycle of each GameState object is as long as that of its view. Therefore, we have to worry only about internal cleanup between relayouts.

    • layout

      private void layout (javafx.collections.ObservableList<? extends Professor> professors, javafx.collections.ObservableList<? extends Board> boards)
      Cleans the slate and injects up-to-date content into the root pane.
      Parameters:
      professors - the professors property
      boards - the boards property
